Call

Call()

Extends SparkPlugin

Instance Members
localMediaStream

Returns the local MediaStream for the call. May initially be null between the time @{Phone#dial is invoked and the media stream is acquired if Phone#dial is invoked without a localMediaStream option.

This property can also be set mid-call in which case the streams sent to the remote party are replaced by this stream. On success, the Call's localMediaStream:change event fires, notifying any listeners that we are now sending media from a new source.

localMediaStream
localMediaStreamUrl

Object URL that refers to Call#localMediaStream. Will be automatically deallocated when the call ends

localMediaStreamUrl
remoteMediaStream

Access to the remote party’s MediaStream. null before connected.

remoteMediaStream
remoteMediaStreamUrl

Object URL that refers to Call#remoteMediaStream. Will be automatically deallocated when the call ends

remoteMediaStreamUrl
sendingAudio

Indicates if the client is sending audio

sendingAudio
sendingVideo

Indicates if the client is sending video

sendingVideo
receivingAudio

Indicates if the client is receiving audio

receivingAudio
receivingVideo

Indicates if the client is receiving video

receivingVideo
status

initiated - Offer was sent to remote party but they have not yet accepted
ringing - Remote party has acknowledged the call
connected - At least one party is still on the call
disconnected - All parties have dropped

status
answer (options)

Answers an incoming call. Only applies to incoming calls. Invoking this method on an outgoing call is a noop

answer(options: Object): Promise
Parameters
options (Object)
Name Description
options.constraints MediaStreamConstraints
Returns
Promise:
acknowledge ()

Use to acknowledge (without answering) an incoming call. Will cause the initiator's Call instance to emit the ringing event.

acknowledge(): Promise
Returns
Promise:
hangup ()

Disconnects the active call. Applies to both incoming and outgoing calls. This method may be invoked in any call state and the SDK should take care to tear down the call and free up all resources regardless of the state.

hangup(): Promise
Returns
Promise:
decline ()

Alias of Call#reject

decline(): Promise
Returns
Promise:
reject

Rejects an incoming call. Only applies to incoming calls. Invoking this method on an outgoing call is a no-op.

reject
Returns
Promise:

error

Feedback

Payload for Call#sendFeedback

Feedback
Properties
userRating (number) : Number between 1 and 5 (5 being best) to let the user score the call
userComments (string) : Freeform feedback from the user about the call
includeLogs (Boolean) : set to true to submit client logs to the Cisco Spark cloud. Note: at this time, all logs, not just call logs, generated by the sdk will be uploaded to the Spark Cloud. Care has been taken to avoid including PII in these logs, but if you've taken advantage of the SDK's logger, you should make sure to avoid logging PII as well.

Phone

Phone()

Extends SparkPlugin

Instance Members
connected

connected Indicates whether or not the WebSocket is connected

connected
registered

indicates whether or not the client is registered with the Cisco Spark cloud

registered
register ()

Registers the client with the Cisco Spark cloud and starts listening for WebSocket events.

Subsequent calls refresh the device registration.

register(): Promise
Returns
Promise:
deregister ()

Disconnects from WebSocket and unregisters from the Cisco Spark cloud.

Subsequent calls will be a noop.

deregister(): Promise
Returns
Promise:
createLocalMediaStream (options)

Create a MediaStream to be used for video preview.

Note: You must explicitly pass the resultant stream to Call#answer() or Phone#dial()

createLocalMediaStream(options: (Object | MediaStreamConstraints)): Promise
Parameters
options ((Object | MediaStreamConstraints))
Name Description
options.constraints MediaStreamConstraints
Returns

undefined:
dial (dialString, options)

Place a call to the specified dialString. A dial string may be an email address or sip uri.

dial(dialString: string, options: Object): Call
Parameters
dialString (string)
options (Object)
Name Description
options.constraints MediaStreamConstraints
options.localMediaStream MediaStream if no stream is specified, a new one will be created based on options.constraints
Returns
Call:
Events
call:incoming

Incoming Call Event

Emitted when a call begins and when Phone#register is invoked and there are active calls.

call:incoming
Properties
call (Call) : The incoming call
